title.narrative: Matching Dutch water treatment solutions with tanneries industries challenges in Bogotá-Colombia

description.narrative: Under the framework of the Partners for Water Program, RVO contracted Witteveen+Bos to prepare and execute a technical assessment of the current impacts of tanneries industries in Bogotá River and the available water re-use and treatment solutions, with special focus on the Dutch water sector, through establishing connections with Colombian partners and an in-depth matchmaking trajectory in 2021. The assignment was carried out in close cooperation with representatives of the Bogotá Mayor's Office (environmental department), RVO, NWP and the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Bogotá. In the San Benito area in Bogotá there are more than 249 tanneries factories, most of them micro industries. To comply with environmental regulations, tanneries in the area have tried to implement different measures and have studied treatment options to reduce their environmental impacts, however, presently still generate serious impacts on water and the surrounding environment (i.e., Bogotá River). Particularly due to the use of chromium and the generation of sulphides during the treating process, and the high COD load of the wastewater. By addressing this problem, the project focusses on various Sustainable Development Goals (SDG), not only on SDG 6 (clean water and sanitation) and SDG15 (protection of ecosystems and reduction of the loss of biodiversity), but also on SDG9, SDG11 and SDG 12 by promoting sustainable production, consumption and reuse. During the project, Witteveen+Bos reviewed the available information and scope by meetings with the different stakeholders. Also, the design proposal of an industrial WWTP prepared by the tanneries was reviewed. Based on the information gathered, it became apparent that the challenges were not only technological (water treatment solutions and cleaner production), but that the solutions should also focus on for example governance, cooperation between institutions and the private sector, product-value, LCA and finance. Therefore, in November 2021, Witteveen+Bos, together with EKN, NWP, Bogotá Mayor’s office and RVO, organised a technical workshop in Bogotá. During the workshop, case studies by (inter)national tanneries, water authorities (such as the Dutch Water Boards, through their programme InspirAgua) and research institutes (Universidad de los Andes, Delft-IHE), leather expert groups (the International Union of Leather Technologists and Chemists Societies (IULTCS)) were discussed, together with presentations of technology providers for leather processing and wastewater treatment and re-use (such as Paques, Nijhuis Industries, Pentair X-flow, Berghof Membranes and IM Innovating). The workshop gave the different stakeholders useful insights not only in options for wastewater treatment and cleaner production, but also that the environmental impact of the tanneries can only be reduced if all stakeholders (private and public) work together towards a solution.
